course.subject: ISDN
course.name: Exploring the World through Smart Mechatronics
course.description: This course provides an introductory experience into the design and application of smart mechatronic systems on building integrative systems. Students will learn how smart integrative systems are built to sense and interact with humans and the environment, to serve everyday real-world needs. The course includes fundamental theory and also practical hands-on labs and projects for the student to acquire the basic knowledge of designing mechatronic systems, using embedded system to control and practice design thinking process. In the lab sessions, students design and build a succession of mechatronic subsystems, leading to an integrated system in a final project. Lecture topics include embedded system design, basic electronics, use of sensors and actuators, system modelling, measurement and control, and appreciation of the impact of smart mechatronics system in solving real-world problems. In the final project, students will apply design thinking approach to meet the project requirements, specified from users’ perspective.

reviews.author: Borong
reviews.title: Best course taken in ISD
reviews.comment_content:
The are basically two parts in the course. The electrical part and the mechanical part.

They all add up like this:
ESP32 programming
Fundamentals of electricity
Logic gates and logic gate circuits (full adder)
Signals
Serial communication
Computer architecture
PID algorithm
Forward kinematics
Inverse kinematics
Open-loop and closed-loop systems
Matrices (coordinate transformation)
Robotic arm control
Pulse Width Modulation (PWM)
Soft robotic arms
Degrees of freedom
reviews.comment_teaching:

So does Winnie.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class participation 5%
Written assignments 15%
Labs and Labs assignment 30%
Midterm Test 20%  
Final Project 30%

I will give the grading a B, because I only got an A instead of A+. I believe there is only one student got an A+, which is only 3 points greater than me in midterm, and we got the same score in other parts.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is actually a bit high. Lab assignment is challenging, but it is the reason why this course is attractive

Six labs will be held in group size of 2-3.

Embedded Systems Basic – Setting up and embedded programming
Implementing simple controller with embedded processors  
Data acquisition and signal filtering
Sensor modules
PWM generation and motor control
PID motion control
(Also a soft robot lab taught by Rob)
